job description:
Background & Purpose of the Job

The purpose of a Scientist in Consumer & Technical Insights is to support product development related work streams for on time and in full delivery of regional innovation, renovation, quality improvement and cost optimization projects\.

Who You Are & What You?ll Do

As an Associate Scientist, you will support specific technical deliverables that are part of different projects run by Technical Project Leaders \(TPL\) within a broader R&D team\.

?You?re a dot connector:The position works in conjunction with broader R&D teams including: Packaging Engineers, CTI \(Consumer Technical Insights\), Microbiology, Material Experts, Data & Digital, Nutrition, Label Compliance and Technical Project Leaders \(TPLs\) and CMI \(Consumer & Market Insights\.

?You love to win, and have fun doing it:Your passion for food will guide you to communicate with external suppliers and international \(Global Design and Global Discover Teams\) interfaces\.

?You?re a story teller:The position requires adapting technical information to communicate results with other cross\-functional team members including marketing, planning, procurement, customer development as well as others\.

?You?re a paradox navigator:The position requires application of technical knowledge and scientific methodologies including bench top formulation, experimental design, analytical methods, statistical procedures as well as data analysis\.

What You?ll Need To Succeed:

+ Ability to express yourself well verbally, in presentations and in writing
+ Ability to identify and provide insights as opposed to data
+ Basic appreciation of the design of a holistic consumer understanding plan for innovation projects
+ Ability to independently design qualitative and quantitative consumer testing
+ Ability to analyze and interpret data with guidance on final conclusions
+ Possess a sound, basic appreciation of advanced testing including pref mapping and modeling and when to apply
+ An understanding how to translate CTI information into technical targets against which products can be designed \(performance & attributes\), developed and measured
+ A basic appreciation of senior stakeholder management \(3 \)
+ Ability to plan, implement and evaluate research plans following UL global guidelines and within project budget
+ Ensure a comprehensive understanding of purpose of testing, documented procedures, purpose, and data interpretation of results, conclusion and insights
+ Independently executes projects with minimum complexity and, under minimal supervision, execute projects with moderate to high complexity
+ Ability to build and manage relationship with suppliers after they are established
+ Possess a working knowledge of the roles the local functional areas play in the overall product development process
+ Ability to identify research needs, brief and manage research partners and lead discussions
